column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower

column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: munity. As the adaptation of the ontology
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower

column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower

column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: 1 Introduction
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column right-indent font-larger hanged-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Multilinguality in ontologies is nowadays de-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: manded by institutions worldwide with a huge
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: number of resources in different languages. One
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: of these institutions is the FAO <sup>1</sup> . Within the
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: NeOn project <sup>2</sup> , the FAO is currently leading a
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: case study on fishery stocks in order to improve
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the interoperability of its information systems.
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: The FAO, as an international organization with
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: five official languages -English, French, Spanish,
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: Arabic and Chinese- deals with heterogeneous
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: and multilingual linguistic resources with differ-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ent granularity levels. This scenario is an illustra-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tive example of the need for semantically orga-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: nizing great amounts of multilingual data. When
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: providing ontologies with multilingual data, one
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: of the activities identified in the NeOn ontology
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: network development process is the Ontology
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified column-top headchar-lower

column2: Localization Activity, that consists in adapting
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: an ontology to a concrete language and culture
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: community, as defined in (Suárez-Figueroa et al.,
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: 2007). In particular, our aim is to obtain multi-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line year tailchar-hiphen

column2: lingual ontologies by localizing its terminologi-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: cal layer (terms or labels that name ontology
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: classes), rather than modifying its conceptualiza-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion. Thus, we propose to link ontologies with a
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: linguistic model, called LIR, whose main feature
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: is that it is holistic in the sense that it (1) pro-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: vides a complete and complementary amount of
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: linguistic data that allows localization of ontol-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ogy concepts to a specific linguistic and cultural
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: universe, and, (2) provides a unified access to
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: aggregated multilingual data. The model we pre-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: sent in this paper is an enhanced version of the
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: one introduced in (Peters et al., 2007).
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail year headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 2 Related work
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column right-indent font-larger aligned-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: The most widespread modality for introducing
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: multilingual data in ontology meta-models con-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: sists in using some ontology properties
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: ( rdfs:label and rdfs:comment <sup>3</sup> )that define
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line

column2: labels and descriptions in natural language of
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: ontology classes. In this system, information is
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: embedded in the ontology. In a similar way, the
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: Simple Knowledge Organization System
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: (SKOS <sup>4</sup> ) data model for semantically structuring
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line

column2: thesauri, taxonomies, etc., permits the labelling
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: of ontology classes with multilingual strings, and
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: even the establishment of some relations between
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: labels (preferred label against the alternative
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: one). In any case, however, both modelling mo-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: dalities restrict the amount of linguistic data that
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: can be included in the ontology, and assume full
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: synonym relations among the multilingual labels
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: associated to one and the same concept.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: A further multilingual model is one adopted by
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: the general purpose lexicon EuroWordNet <sup>5</sup>
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified font-largest hanged-line headchar-lower above-double-space above-line-space

column2: <sup>3</sup> www.w3.org/TR/rdf-schema/

page=0 xpos=4 ypos=9 single-column left-indent right-indent column-top line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numeric-only above-line-space

column2: Coling 2008: Companion volume – Posters and Demonstrations, pages 67–70
column3: page=0 xpos=1 ypos=9 single-column left-indent right-indent font-smallest hanged-line longer-tail line-space year headchar-capital

column2: Manchester, August 2008
column3: page=0 xpos=3 ypos=9 single-column left-indent right-indent font-smallest indented-line shorter-tail year headchar-capital page-bottom

column2: (EWN). EWN consists of monolingual ontolo-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified page-top tailchar-hiphen

column2: gies, each one reflecting the linguistic and cul-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tural specificities of a certain language, linked to
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: each other through an interlingual set of common
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: concepts that allows building equivalences
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: among ontologies. Although concept equiva-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: lences among localized ontologies are reliable
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: and reflect cultural differences, the quantity of
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: linguistic information is also limited to labels and
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: definitions attached to concepts.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Finally, we come to the upward trend in recent
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: research for providing ontologies with linguistic
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: data, which is the association of the ontology
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: meta-model to a linguistic model keeping both
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: separate. The model for representing and orga-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: nizing the linguistic information can be a data
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: base (as in GENOMA-KB <sup>6</sup> or OncoTerm 7 ), or an
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: ontology (as in the case of LingInfo (Buitelaar et
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: al., 2006) or LexOnto (Cimiano et al. 2007)).
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: The main advantage of this modeling modality is
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: that it allows the inclusion of as much linguistic
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: information as wished, as well as the possibility
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: of establishing relations among linguistic ele-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ments. Thus, conceptual information is greatly
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: enriched with linguistic data. Additionally, these
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: systems are considered domain independent, and
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: can be linked to any domain ontology.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: The differentiating aspect among the men-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: tioned systems is determined by the kind of lin-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: guistic classes that make up each model. De-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: pending on the linguistic needs of the end user,
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: some models will be more suitable than others.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: LingInfo or LexOnto can offer not only multilin-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: gual strings to classes and properties of the on-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tology, but also a deeper morphosyntactic de-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: composition of linguistic elements, in the case of
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: LingInfo, or a greater focus on syntactic struc-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: tures by means of subcategorization frames, in
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: LexOnto. Our LIR model, however, is more in
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: the line of GENOMA-KB or OncoTerm, in the
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: sense that they follow localization or transla-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tional approaches. The main objective of the LIR
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: is to localize a certain ontology category to the
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: linguistic and cultural universe of a certain natu-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ral language and to capture translation specifici-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ties among languages. Morphosyntactic informa-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion is left in the background, although interop-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: erability with ISO standards for representing that
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: sort of information is foreseen. Contrary to GE-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: NOMA-KB or OncoTerm, the LIR is represented
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: as an ontology and will be provided with the
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: necessary infrastructure to access external re-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: <sup>6</sup> http://genoma.iula.upf.edu:8080/genoma
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line shorter-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-super

column2: <sup>7</sup> http://www.ugr.es/~oncoterm/alpha-index.html
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line longer-tail headchar-super column-bottom

column2: sources for obtaining linguistic data and main-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified column-top headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: taining links to supplier resources (cf. 5).

column2: 2.1 Interoperability with existing standards
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column right-indent aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading2 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Lexical knowledge is expressed in various ways
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: in terminological and linguistic resources. There
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: is a wealth of proposals for enhancing the inter-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: operability of lexical knowledge by encoding it
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: following standard models. As the most impor-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tant initiatives we take into account two ISO (In-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ternational Organization for Standardization <sup>8</sup> <sub>)</sub>
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: standards: The Terminological Markup Frame-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: work (TMF <sup>9</sup> ) (and the associated TermBase eX-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: change format; TBX <sup>10</sup> ), which captures the un-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: derlying structure and representation of comput-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: erized terminologies, and the Lexical Markup
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: Framework (LMF) (Francopoulo et al., 2006), an
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-capital

column2: abstract meta-model that provides a common,
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: standardized framework for the construction of
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: computational lexicons.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: The LIR model adopts a number of data cate-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: gories from these standards in order to guarantee
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: interoperability with them. For instance, the no-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion of lexical entry or lexeme, in itself a well
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: known central linguistic notion of a unit of form
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: and meaning, has been taken from LMF, whereas
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the attribute term type, which covers representa-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tional aspects such as full forms versus abbrevia-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tions, has been taken from TMF.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 3 Linguistic Information Repository
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column right-indent font-larger aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: As shown in Figure 1, the linguistic information
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: captured in the LIR is organized around the
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: LexicalEntry class. A lexical entry is a unit of
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: form and meaning in a certain language (Saloni
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: et al., 1990). Therefore, it is associated to the
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower

column2: classes Language , Lexicalization and
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: Sense . A set of related lexicalizations or term
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: variants shares the same meaning within the spe-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: cific context of a certain cultural and linguistic
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: universe. E.g., Food and Agriculture Organiza-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion and FAO would be two lexicalizations
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: linked to the same sense. Thanks to the expres-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: siveness of the hasVariant relation, it is possi-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ble to say that the one is acronym of the other.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: The Language class at the LexicalEntry
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: level allows launching searches in which just
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: those lexical entries related to one natural lan-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: guage are shown to the user, thus displaying the
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: ontology in the selected language.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: <sup>8</sup> www.iso.org
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line shorter-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-super

column2: <sup>9</sup> http://www.loria.fr/projets/TMF/
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line longer-tail headchar-super

column2: <sup>10</sup> http://www.lisa.org/standards/tbx/
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line longer-tail headchar-super column-bottom above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space
page=1 xpos=4 ypos=9 single-column left-indent right-indent column-top line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numeric-only page-bottom

column2: Sense is considered a language-specific unit
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column left-indent page-top headchar-capital

column2: of intensional lexical semantic description
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: (ibidem), which comes to fruition through the
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line

column2: Definition class expressed in natural lan-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: guage. Therefore, Sense is an empty class real-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ized by means of the Definition . By keeping
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: senses in the linguistic model independent from
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: ontology concepts, we allow capturing cultural
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: specificities that may slightly differ from the
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: concept expressed in the ontology. Definition
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: has a pointer to the linguistic resource it has been
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: obtained from. In this way reliability and author-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ity of definitions are guaranteed.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Then, Lexicalization is related to its
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: Source or provenance, to a Note class and to a
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-capital

column2: UsageContext class. The Source class aims
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: again at being a pointer to the resource where the
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: information has been extracted from. Note is
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: here linked to Lexicalization , but it could be
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: linked to any other class in the model. It allows
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the inclusion of supplemental information; e.g.,
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: usage specificities of a certain lexicalization
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: within its language system. By linking Note to
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the Sense or Definition classes we could
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: make explicit possible differences among senses
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: in different languages. The UsageContext class
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: provides information about the behaviour of a
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: certain lexicalization within the language system
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: it belongs to. Finally, lexical semantic equiva-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: lences are established among lexical entries
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: within the same language ( hasSynonym or
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: hasAntonym ), or across languages ( hasTrans-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: lation ). Note that we use the latter label to es-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tablish equivalences between lexicalizations in
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: different languages, although it is assumed that
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: words identified as translation equivalents are
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: rarely identical in sense. As Hirst (2004) stated,
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: more usually they are merely cross-lingual near-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: synonyms, but this approach is adopted for the
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: practical reason of providing multilinguality.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: The LIR is linked to the OntologyElement
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: class of the OWL meta-model permitting in this
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: way the association of multilingual information
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: to any element of the ontology. Finally, it is left
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: to say that the rationale underlying LIR is not to
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: design a lexicon for different natural languages
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: and then establish links to ontology concepts, but
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: to associate multilingual linguistic knowledge to
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the conceptual knowledge represented by the
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: ontology. What the LIR does is to associate word
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: senses –as defined by Hirst (2004)- in different
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower

column2: languages to ontology concepts, although word
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: senses and concepts can not be said to overlap
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: since they are tightly related to the particular vi-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen column-bottom

column2: sion of a language and its culture, whereas ontol-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified column-top headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ogy concepts try to capture objects of the real
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: world, and are defined and organized according
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: to expert criteria agreed by consensus.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 4 Application of the LIR in NeOn
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column right-indent font-larger aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: The LIR has been developed within the NeOn
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: project and is currently being implemented. In
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: order to check its suitability, it was evaluated
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: against the linguistic requirements of the use
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: cases participating in this project (see Note 2):
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-colon

column2: the Spanish pharmaceutical industry, and the
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: Fisheries Stock system of the FAO. Both use
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: cases are working in the development of ontolo-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: gies for organizing the information they have in
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: several languages. As a consequence, one of the
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: requirements for the NeOn architecture was to
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: support multilingual ontologies.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: As already introduced, the LIR not only pro-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: vides multilingual information to any ontology
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: element, but it also enables unified access to ag-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: gregated multilingual data, previously scattered
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: in heterogeneous resources. In that way, it inte-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: grates the necessary linguistic information from
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: use case resources and offers a complete and
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: complementary amount of linguistic data.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Regarding the FAO use case, the LIR was
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: evaluated against the recent developed model for
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: the AGROVOC thesaurus, the AGROVOC Con-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: cept Server (Liang et al., 2008). This is a con-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: cept-based multilingual repository, which, com-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: pared to a traditional Knowledge Organization
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: System, allows the representation of more se-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: mantics such as specific relationships between
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: concepts and relationships between multilingual
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: lexicalizations. It serves as a pool of agricultural
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: concepts and is a starting point in the develop-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ment of domain ontologies. The adequacy of the
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: LIR model was positively evaluated against the
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: linguistic requirements of the Concept Server in
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: terms of flexible association of language specific
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: lexicalizations with agricultural domain con-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: cepts, and compatibility with TBX.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 5 Conclusions and future research
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column right-indent font-larger aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading1 above-double-space above-line-space

column2: In this contribution we have raised the impending
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: need of international organizations dealing with
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: multilingual information for representing multi-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: linguality in ontologies. In order to obtain multi-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: lingual ontologies, we have proposed the associa-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tion of the ontology meta-model to a linguistic
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower column-bottom above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space
page=2 xpos=4 ypos=9 single-column left-indent right-indent column-top line-blank-line line-double-space line-space numeric-only page-bottom

column2: __Figure 1__
column3: page=3 xpos=1 ypos=-8 single-column centered left-indent right-indent box page-top figure-area above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Figure 1. LIR model.
column3: page=3 xpos=3 ypos=0 single-column centered left-indent right-indent indented-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space string-figure headchar-capital tailchar-period column-bottom above-double-space above-line-space

column2: model, the LIR. The LIR has proven to be a ho-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified column-top line-double-space line-space headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: listic linguistic information repository with the
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: following benefits:
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-colon

column2:  Provision of a complete and complementary
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line longer-tail

column2: set of linguistic elements in each language for
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower

column2: localizing ontology elements
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower

column2:  Homogeneous access to linguistic information
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line longer-tail

column2: distributed in heterogeneous resources with dif-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ferent granularity
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower

column2:  Establishment of relations between linguistic
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line longer-tail

column2: elements, and solution to conceptualization mis-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: matches among different cultures
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower

column2: Besides, within NeOn there is a current research
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: regarding the integration of the LIR with the La-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: belTranslator tool (Espinoza et al., 2007), that
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line year headchar-lower

column2: allows: (1) quick access to external multilingual
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: resources, (2) an automatic translation of the on-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tology terminological layer, (3) an automatic
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: storage of the resulting multilingual information
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: in the LIR, and (4) convenient editing possibili-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ties for users in distributed environments.
